report.title: Sildenafil – pulmonary hypertension – India (Repurposing Scan)

executive_summary: Current guidelines for pulmonary hypertension provide general authoritative recommendations but no specific detailed mention of sildenafil. A PubMed search from 2020 to 2025 yielded no new publications specifically concerning sildenafil and pulmonary hypertension in this period. Recent news includes several regional analyses and comparison studies involving sildenafil for pulmonary hypertension in India and other populations, indicating ongoing clinical interest and application. The presence of news about regulatory approvals also suggests continued importance of sildenafil formulations.

highlights: No Phase III trials identified in India

top_trials.title: Hemodynamic Effects of Acute Normobaric Hypoxia During Exercise in Patients With Pulmonary Hypertension: Single-center Randomized Controlled Trial
Sildenafil in US Heart Failure Patients (SilHF-US)
Sildenafil in Heart Failure (SilHF); An Investigator Initiated Multinational Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial.

A Local, Multicentre, Open Label Access Study, To Provide Sildenafil Therapy For Subjects Who Completed A1481156 Study And Are Judged By The Investigator To Derive Clinical Benefit From Continued Treatment With Sildenafil For Subjects In India
top_trials.sponsor: Pfizer's Upjohn has merged with Mylan to form Viatris Inc.
